page.title: 01ORFORD, SUFFOLK
page.content: Population approx. 1000. Mixture of natives, incomers, weekenders mostly sailors. Soil is sand and loam, most masrshland near the river now drained and under cultivation. Some fishing and famous restaurant for oysters etc. Tourists in summer come to castle. Farming cereals, mustard, beans, beet, few cattle on salt marsh. Some employment by M.O.D. on Orfordness. Havergate island RSPB Reserve. Mainly deciduous woodland. Sudbourne Hall Estate for shooting. Good shopping facilities. Bus service to Woodbridge weekdays. Doctors group practice, primary school has children from neighbouring villages. Older children bussed to Butley or Woodbridge. Many retired inhabitants. Local clubs - youth, yatch club, gardening, W.I. singing group, Local news sheet monthly. Orford Town Trust guards
